intro: Spiesia pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula and parts of southern France. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Spiesia pyrenaica is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, moist conditions.
